primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The struggle of the 'gospel people' to maintain their big decision for Christ against the oppressive status quo of the Empire, resulting in eschatological vindication.

tekstueel_bewijs: They have endured by their big decision
They enacted such futures in defiance
The people who perform miracles against the deathly claims
the shape and character and meaning of our lives
their faith, with its alternative vision
the story of God who makes things new
It is good news for us
the Lamb who has broken the deathly power
He summons the Easter God into the zone of death

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily identified with socio-political structures and 'settled arrangements' rather than ontological sin or death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The preacher's personal decision regarding an airplane seat as a micro-enactment of the big decision.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Preacher
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The small decision is presented as the fruit or evidence of the primary program's success.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Gospel Vision → New Life → The Saints
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Lamb → The Church ← The Empire

voorbeelden_god_subject: God will wipe away every tear
voorbeelden_mens_subject: They have endured by their big decision

voorbeelden: must be defended at all costs
they trust that the gospel power... will prevail
allow making decisions against what we thought

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' narrative. It focuses on the human 'will' (the big decision) as the engine of the story.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is achieved through human endurance and 'deciding' for the alternative vision.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is taken seriously as a social force, but less so as a spiritual condition.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While using high Christological language (The Lamb), the functional engine is the human 'decision'. God provides the vision, but man performs the endurance.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: It all happened because of Peter. Without him there would be only death.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God will wipe away every tear from their eyes.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Peter is explicitly framed as a 'stand-in' for what the church should do.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on Christ as the only one who 'comes out of the great ordeal' on our behalf, whose resurrection is the only reason Tabitha rises.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to make 'big decisions' and perform 'miracles'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism where human faithfulness is the catalyst for divine newness.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The link between the 'big decision' and 'small decisions' is logically consistent but theologically leans toward Pelagianism.
spanning_punten: The Lamb is the shepherd, yet Peter is the one without whom there is only death.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the Lamb has defeated the empire!

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not mentioned; competence comes from the 'vision' and 'decision'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'capitulation' to the empire or 'bad decisions' like seat choices.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a call to action where the Church is the Subject and God/The Lamb is the Helper/Resource.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: Peter/The Church is the subject of the resurrection power.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make the Lamb the Subject who acts upon Peter and Tabitha.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Without Peter there would be only death,' use 'Because the Lamb lives, death could not hold Tabitha, even when Peter was just a witness.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the hero making decisions.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Identify the hearer with Tabitha (dead/helpless) or the 'vulnerable' who are carried by the Shepherd.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Lamb gives the power to endure when the 'will' fails.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Death and Sin as internal powers that no 'decision' can defeat.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just a social system, the solution is just social activism.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'small decisions' (Ethics) are almost fused with the 'big decision' (Soteriology).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Establish the Lamb's victory as a finished fact that *allows* for decisions, rather than decisions funding the victory.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically powerful and uses evocative imagery, but needs to guard against making the Gospel a matter of human willpower.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the airplane story is a great 'hook'; actantially, it reduces the Gospel to a series of choices.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis identifies the Lamb; semiotics reveals the Lamb is actually a 'tool' for the Church's 'big decision'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the 'Easter' vocabulary, the functional Subject is the human 'decider', making it structurally anthropocentric.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Prophetic Moralism' where the call to social resistance replaces the proclamation of divine rescue.
